intro: Hesperaster pumila, commonly known as the dwarf starwort, is a small annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, with slender, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually pale yellow or white, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stem. Hesperaster pumila is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
